Class Pokemon_DBHelper

java.lang.Object
org.pokemondatabase.DBHelper.Pokemon_DBHelper
public class Pokemon_DBHelper extends Object

Used for the Pokémon table to accept SQL queries (with execute and getExecuteResults) and prepare the SQL queries using Select, insert, update, delete, and selectToTable. Holds all current column types as variables.

IMPORTANT DEPENDENCIES

  • DBHelper: DBHelper calls this class to bring it into scope when other classes call the DBHelper.

Created using the SQLHelper GUI

  • Field Details

    • pokedex_number

      public static final String pokedex_number
      Defines constant values for the Pokémon database columns.

      These constants are used throughout the application to reference database fields.

      • pokedex_number – Pokémon’s unique Pokédex number.
      • pokemon_name – Pokémon’s name.
      • next_evolution_level – What level the Pokémon evolves next.
      • weight – Pokémon’s weight.
      • height – Pokémon’s height.
      • has_been_caught – States if the Pokémon has been caught.
      • pokedex_entry – Pokédex description of the Pokémon.
      • primary_type – Pokémon’s primary type.
      • secondary_type – Pokémon’s secondary type (if any).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • insert

      public void insert(Integer pokedex_number, String pokemon_name, Integer next_evolution_level, String weight, String height, Integer has_been_caught, String pokedex_entry, Integer primary_type, Integer secondary_type)
      Insert a new record into the database
      Parameters:
      pokedex_number - String Pokédex Number
      pokemon_name - String Pokémon Name
      next_evolution_level - Integer Pokémon next evolution level
      weight - String Pokémon Weight
      height - String Pokémon Height
      has_been_caught - Integer Pokémon Caught status
      pokedex_entry - String Pokédex entry
      primary_type - Integer Pokémon Primary Type
      secondary_type - Integer Pokémon Secondary Type

    • delete

      public void delete(String whatField, String whatValue)
      Remove a record from the database
      Parameters:
      whatField - The column you want to reference (Should be the Key)
      whatValue - The value in the column to specify the row to delete

    • update

      public void update(String whatField, String whatValue, String whereField, String whereValue)
      Update a record in the database
      Parameters:
      whatField - The column you want to reference (Should be the Key)
      whatValue - The value in the column to specify the row to update
      whereField - What column needs to be updated
      whereValue - What is the new value to be updated

    • updateCaughtStatus

      public void updateCaughtStatus(Boolean currentCaughtStatus, String whereValue)
      Update the caught status in the database
      Parameters:
      currentCaughtStatus - Boolean The current caught status
      whereValue - What row will be updated (Pokédex number)

    • updateAll

      public void updateAll(String newPokedexNumber, String newPokemonName, String newEvoLevel, String newWeight, String newHeight, String newCaughtStatus, String newEntry, String newPrimaryType, String newSecondaryType, String currentPokedexNumber)
      Updates all columns in the database
      Parameters:
      newPokedexNumber - String NEW Pokédex Number
      newPokemonName - String NEW Pokémon Name
      newEvoLevel - Integer NEW Pokémon next evolution number
      newWeight - Pokémon NEW Weight
      newHeight - Pokémon NEW Height
      newCaughtStatus - Integer NEW Pokémon Caught status
      newEntry - String NEW Pokédex entry
      newPrimaryType - Integer NEW Pokémon Primary Type
      newSecondaryType - Integer NEW Pokémon Secondary Type
      currentPokedexNumber - String OLD Pokédex Number

    • select

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> select(String fields, String whatField, String whatValue, String sortField, String sort)
      Completes a SQL "select" command
      Parameters:
      fields - The fields to be displayed in the output
      whatField - The field to search within
      whatValue - The value to search for within whatField
      sortField - The field that the data will be sorted by
      sort - Use ASC or DESC to specify the sorting order
      Returns:
      {ArrayListinvalid input: '<'ArrayList
